ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: NHS High Weald Lewes Havens CCG

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: NHS High Weald Lewes Havens CCG

SHORT_DESCR.P: Non-Emergency Passenger Transport Services for High Weald Lewes Havens CCG acting on behalf of itself and also Coastal West Sussex CCG, Crawley CCG,Horsham and Mid Sussex CCG, Brighton and Hove CCG, Hastings and Rother CCG, Eastbourne Hailsham and Seaford CCG.

MAIN_SITE.P: The areas covered by the CCGs listed in II.1.4) above.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Provision of patient transport services within the areas of High Weald Lewes Havens CCG, Coastal West Sussex CCG, Crawley CCG, Horsham and Mid Sussex CCG, Brighton and Hove CCG, Hastings and Rother CCG, Eastbourne Hailsham and Seaford CCG.
Duration: 3 years with an option to extend for 1 further year.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: Option to extend contract for 1 further year at the end of the initial 3-year duration.

INFO_ADD.P: The contract has to be let urgently because of the risk (arising for unforeseen reasons) of being left without a provider of essential patient transport services.

D_JUSTIFICATION.P: Following the original tender exercise in 2015, only 1 tender was received. The contract was awarded to that tenderer. Following unforeseen issues, the contract is now likely to be terminated early. Therefore there are no suitable bids, and the CCG and the other participating CCGs have an urgent need for the patient transport services forming part of this contract and cannot be left without a provider. The contract duration is the same as awarded under the initial tender process.

ADDRESS_CONTRACTOR.OFFICIALNAME: South Central Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust
ADDRESS_CONTRACTOR.ADDRESS: Unit 7 & 8 Talisman Business Centre, Talisman Road, Oxfordshire

INFO_ADD.P: The contract was initially awarded following a tender exercise in respect of which only 1 tender was received. Due to unforeseen issues there is a risk that the contract will need to be terminated early and there will thus be no provision of patient transport services. Therefore this contract needs to be placed urgently.

ADDRESS_REVIEW_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: High Court of England and Wales

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: Following publication of this notice, the contracting authority will allow a 10-day standstill period prior to entering into the contract, pursuant to regulation 99(3)(c) of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015.
